description.narrative: National and subnational child protection systems and other stakeholders have an increased capacity to generate demand and provide a quality continuum of services in a coordinated manner, and to support protective norms for children and adolescents and their families (including those with disabilities and Roma), focusing on protection from, and prevention of, violence and child separation, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The social inclusion of all children and adolescents, especially vulnerable ones, is supported by quality, equitable and coordinated health, education and child protection systems and protective social norms.

sector.narrative: Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents

Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational child protection systems and other stakeholders have an increased capacity to generate demand and provide a quality continuum of services in a coordinated manner, and to support protective norms for children and adolescents and their families (including those with disabilities and Roma), focusing on protection from, and prevention of, violence and child separation

description.narrative: UNICEF sustained the ‘minimum package of services' (MPS) model, implemented in partnership with (sub)-national counterparts, and continued to strengthen their capacity for early identification and cross-sectoral interventions to prevent and protect children from violence and separation from family. A summative evaluation of MPS pointed out that the model offers a relevant, effective, efficient and sustainable pathway toward progressive national scale-up, as part of child protection system reform. Efforts to bolster the social services workforce and leverage resources for de-institutionalization contributed to shaping the provision of a quality continuum of services and protective environment for children deprived of adequate parental care. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2020

title.narrative: No. of social services workers in the country, disaggregated urban-rural.
Pre-service and in-service training for social workers include modules on early detection, intervention and referrals, support marginalized groups to access and use services

baseline.value: No module included in the training

target.value: 2022:All developed modules included in pre- and in-service training

actual.value: 2020:Current adjustments for continuous education using digital technologies and establishing of a mechanism at national level to ensure the uptake of digital technologies in social work

title.narrative: 2.4 Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide

baseline.value: The Child Protection system has responsive services and is starting developing preventive services. No coordination

target.value: 2022:Both preventive and responsive services, and coordination framework available

actual.value: 2020:Law on the rights of the child approved by the Parliament. Amendments for the Law on social assistance still in debate in the Parliament.
